channel.title: Just fucking do this i really need to get off

item.title: Just fucking do this i really need to get off
item.dc:creator: @Waffles1 Waffles!!
item.description:
@Waffles1 wrote:

case 1278: boolean working = false; if(playerHasItem(1351) || playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 1351) { working = !working; while(!working) { // If working is true, loop // Does action till working is done. startAnimation(879); addItem(1511, 1); addSkillXP(1000, 8); sendMessage("You get some logs."); resetAnimation(); actionTimer = 100; actionTimer =- playerLevel[8]; treetimer ++; break; // Break the loop } } else { sendMessage("You need an axe to cut this tree!"); sendMessage("Try ::axeplz"); } if (treetimer == 5){ ReplaceObject2(objectX, objectY, 1342, -1, 10); } break;
It doesn’t do anything…I tried making a public boolean for working, but there was a random actiontimer on the tree, and it didn’t loop.

Read full topic

Edit that up.

item.title: Just fucking do this i really need to get off
item.dc:creator: @Waffles1 Waffles!!
item.description:
@Waffles1 wrote:

Wow, I was messing around and figured it out!
treetimer =+ 1;
DURRRRRRRR
treetimer ++;
Like you stated with i++.

Aftereffect, if you could put a loop on this for me:

case 1278: if(playerHasItem(1351) || (playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 1351)) { startAnimation(875); addItem(1511, 1); addSkillXP(1000, 8); sendMessage("You get some logs."); resetAnimation(); actionTimer = 100; actionTimer =- playerLevel[8]; treetimer ++; } else { sendMessage("You need an axe to cut this tree!"); sendMessage("Try ::axeplz"); } if (treetimer == 5){ ReplaceObject2(objectX, objectY, 1342, -1, 10); } break;
I would freaking love you.

Read full topic
